story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does Sunday Creek Classic land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Sunday Creek Classic? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Sunday Creek Classic scored 44 out of 100. Grassroots tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Sunday Creek Classic?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Sunday Creek Classic. Kenilworth, Queensland. 62 mi. Rolling hinterland gravel through dairy country.
beats.text_on_screen: Sunday Creek Classic | Kenilworth, Queensland | 62 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Fourteen dimensions. Here's where it lands. Value. 4 out of 5. Strong value proposition. The race delivers 120km of varied terrain with 3,000m climbing through Queensland backcountry, plus camping at race HQ for $20. Length. 3 out of 5. Proper race distance. Enough to hurt. Elevation. 3 out of 5. Enough vertical to remind you gravity exists. Community. 3 out of 5. Community is a real selling point. Wild&Co is building something with their Gravel Classics brand, expanding to the Kyogle Classic in 2026, so they're not just running one event and disappearing. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Mid-range expenses. Budget a proper race weekend. Logistics. 2 out of 5. You'll figure it out. Eventually. 7 AM start from Kenilworth Showground is straightforward, with $20 camping available on-site and hot showers for $1 coin. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Mild technical demands. Pick decent tires. Climate. 2 out of 5. Weather cooperates more often than not. Late May in Queensland should be mild autumn weather, but there's zero historical weather data available for race day conditions.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The remaining six. Quick-fire. Adventure. 2 out of 5. Light adventure. Nothing wild. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Adequate. Room for improvement. Experience. 2 out of 5. Pleasant enough. Won't change your life. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Low altitude. Breathe easy. Prestige. 1 out of 5. Zero name recognition. Field Depth. 1 out of 5. Sparse start line. Plenty of elbow room.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.narration: Where Sunday Creek Classic earns its score.
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

weaknesses: Very small town with minimal amenities
Tiny field with no competitive depth

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: The logistics. What you actually need to know.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: Brisbane 1.5-2 hours drive, or Sunshine Coast Airport 1 hour
Lodging: Very limited lodging in Kenilworth. Stay in nearby towns or Sunshine Coast. Book early.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Grassroots Hinterland Ride. Only if you're local to Queensland and want an affordable, low-key gravel ride. Not worth traveling for.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Sunday Creek Classic isn't quite right for you. For better Queensland events: Noosa Gravel Enduro. For similar grassroots vibes: other regional Australian events.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Sunday Creek Classic? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic reveal pose, tier badge prominent, 'Sunday Creek Classic' bold text, tier badge 'GRASSROOTS', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.
